event.descr:
The appliance is in the process of rebooting. The name of the user who initiated the reboot is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmRebootStartedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
A user logged into the appliance. This trap is sent when a user logs into the CLI port or when a user exits a serial session. The name of the user who logged in is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserLoginTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
A user logged out of the appliance. This trap is sent when a user logs out of the CLI port or when a user exits a serial session. The name of the user who logged out is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserLogoutTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
A serial session has started. The name of the user who is connected to the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The port number on the appliance that the session is using is contained in ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier. The port name on the appliance that the session is using is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSerialSessionStartedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
A serial session has stoppped. The name of the user who was connected to the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The port number on the appliance that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier. The port name on the appliance that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSerialSessionStoppedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
A serial session has been terminated or preempted by another user. The name of the user who terminated or preempted the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was terminated or preempted from the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName. The port number on the appliance that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier. The port name on the appliance that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSerialSessionTerminatedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectSessionIdentifier=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The appliance has started an upgrade of a software image. The name of the user who initiated the image upgrade is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The type of image that is being upgraded is contained in ccmTrapObjectImageType. The version of the image that the appliance is upgrading to is contained in ccmTrapObjectImageNewVersion. The version of the image that the appliance is currently running is contained in ccmTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectImageType %parm[#2]%;

boot(1) app(2)

ccmTrapObjectImageNewVersion %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmImageUpgradeStartedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectImageType=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectImageNewVersion=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectImageCurrentVersion=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This object contains the results of the upgrade of a software image. The result is contained in ccmTrapObjectImageUpgradeResults. The type of software image the upgrade result is for is contained in ccmTrapObjectImageType.

ccmTrapObjectImageUpgradeResults %parm[#1]%;

imageUpgradeSuccess(1) imageUpgradeTftpNoSocket(2) imageUpgradeTftpConnectFailure(3) imageUpgradeTftpRequestDenied(4) imageUpgradeTftpBadPacket(5) imageUpgradeTftpOOS(6) imageUpgradeTftpTooBig(7) imageUpgradeTftpTimeout(8) imageUpgradeAlreadyInProgress(9) imageUpgradeCannotStart(10) imageUpgradeMemoryError(11) imageUpgradeTftpProtocolError(12) imageUpgradeBadType(13) imageUpgradeInvalidAppDowngrade(14) imageUpgradeChecksumError(15) imageUpgradeFlashError(16) imageUpgradeInternalError(17) imageUpgradeFileNotFound(18) imageUpgradeBadHeader(19) imageUpgradeIncompatibleHeader(20)

ccmTrapObjectImageType %parm[#2]%;

boot(1) app(2)
event.logmsg: avctCcmImageUpgradeResultsTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectImageUpgradeResults=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectImageType=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A new user has been added to the local user database. The name of the user who added the new user is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the new user is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserAddedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A user has been deleted from the local user database. The name of the user who deleted the user is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was deleted is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserDeletedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A user was modified. The the name of the user who modified the user is contain in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was modified is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserModifiedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A user failed to authenticate with the appliance. The name of the user who failed to authenticate is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserAuthenticationFailureTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]%

event.descr: The appliance has been commanded to set itself to factory defaults. The appliance sends this trap after being commanded to set itself to factory defaults but prior to actually reverting to factory defaults.
event.logmsg: avctCcmFactoryDefaultsSetTrap trap received

event.descr:
The appliance detected a cry for help string on a serial port. The serial port number the cry for help string was detected on is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber. The serial port name the cry for help string was detected on is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The cry for help string that was detected is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortAlertString.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectPortAlertString %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmPortAlertTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectPortAlertString=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The appliance has loaded a configuration file. The name of the user who commanded the appliance to load the configuration file is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the file that was loaded is contained in ccmTrapObjectFileName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectFileName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmConfigurationFileLoadedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectFileName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
The appliance has loaded a user database file. The name of the user who commanded the appliance to load the user database file is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the file that was loaded is contained in ccmTrapObjectFileName.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectFileName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserDatabaseFileLoadedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectFileName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
The appliance monitor has detected that the power on/off control signal is high on a serial port indicating that the server attached to the port is powered on. This trap is sent on initialization if the condition is detected. Subsequent traps occur only if there is a transition of this signal from low to high. The affected serial port number is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber. The affected serial port name is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmPortPowerOnDetectTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
The appliance monitor has detected that the power on/off control signal is low on a serial port indicating that server attached to the port is powered off. This trap is sent on initialization if the condition is detected. Subsequent traps occur only if there is a transition of this signal from high to low. The affected serial port number is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber. The affected serial port name is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmPortPowerOffDetectTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A power device attached to the appliance is detected to be online. This trap is sent upon initialization of the power device if it is online and responding. Subsequent traps are sent if the power device transitions from offline to online. The location of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation. The port number on the appliance that the power device is attached to is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort. The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSpcDeviceOnlineTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A power device attached to the appliance is detected to be offline. This trap is sent upon initialization of the power device if it is not responding. Subsequent traps are sent if the power device transitions from online to offline. The location of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation. The port number on the appliance that the power device is attached to is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort. The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSpcDeviceOfflineTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A power device attached to the appliance has a login error. A login error occurs when the appliance is unable to login to the power device using the user name configured in the appliance. The location of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation. The port number on the appliance that the power device is attached to is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort. The user name attempting to login to the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLogin. The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLogin %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber %parm[#4]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSpcLoginErrTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLogin=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber=%parm[#4]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
A power device attached to the appliance has detected an on sense failure for a socket. An on sense failure occurs when a socket should be in the on state but is actually in the off state. The location of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation. The port number on the appliance that the power device is attached to is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort. The socket number that has the failure is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcSocket. The socket name that has the failure is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

event.descr:
A user account has been locked. The IP address of the client from which the last connection was attempted is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. If 0.0.0.0, then the user was locked attempting to authentication from the local Serial CLI. The name of the user who was locked is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName. The reason for which the user account has been locked is contained in ccmTrapObjectLockReason.

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectLockReason %parm[#3]%;

consecutiveAuthenticationFailures(1) administrative(2)
event.logmsg: avctCcmUserLockedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectLockReason=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
A user account has been unlocked. The IP address of the client that originated the unlock request is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. When the user account is unlocked by an appliance reboot or by the expiration of the lockout period (as specified in the ccmTrapObjectUnlockReason object), the IP address will be 0.0.0.0. The name of the user who unlocked the user is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. When the user account is unlocked by an appliance reboot or by the expiration of the lockout period (as specified in the ccmTrapObjectUnlockReason object), the name of the user will be blank. The name of the user who was unlocked is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName. The reason for which the user account has been unlocked is contained in ccmTrapObjectUnlockReason.

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectUnlockReason %parm[#4]%;

event.descr:
The session status or power status of one or more connection paths has changed. A list of all connection paths known to the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectAggregateServerStatusChanged. This trap is always sent by the appliance on bootup to report the current status of all connection paths.

ccmTrapObjectAggregateServerStatusChanged %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmAggregatedServerStatusChangedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectAggregateServerStatusChanged=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
A request to enable a NFS port was sent. The ccmTrapObjectUserName contains the name of the user that requested this operation. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the port number of the serial port to be enabled.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortEnableRqstdTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
A request to disable a NFS port was sent. The ccmTrapObjectUserName contains the name of the user that requested this operation. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the port number of the serial port to be disabled.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortDisableRqstdTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a port needs mount. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the port number of the serial port that needs to be mounted. The ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus returns the status of the port at the time that this trap was generated. The ccmTrapObjectNfsPriErrorReason specifies the main reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum. The ccmTrapObjectNfsSecErrorReason specifies the secondary reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum or if there is no detailed reason then the value will be 9999 (no error).

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus %parm[#2]%;

event.descr:
The first attempt to open the NFS file failed. Several attempts will be made until the operation will get canceled. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the port number of the serial port that failed. The ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus returns the status of the port at the time that this trap was generated. The ccmTrapObjectNfsPriErrorReason specifies the main reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum. The ccmTrapObjectNfsSecErrorReason specifies the secondary reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum or if there is no detailed reason then the value will be 9999 (no error).

event.descr:
This trap is sent when an attempt to open a file through NFS is successful. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the port number of the serial port that was successfully open.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortFileOpenOKTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a write file operation fails. If multiple consecutive write operations fail, this trap is only sent once, upon the occurrence of the first failure. Once sent, this trap will not be sent again until a write operation has been successfully performed, and a period of 15 minutes has elapsed without any additional write operation failures and without any overrun errors. (I.e. This trap is sent only when the status of the port is 'No recent errors.) The port number of the serial port on which the failure occurred is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber. The status of the serial port on which the failure occurred is contained in ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus. (This is the status of the port at the time that the Trap was generated.) The ccmTrapObjectNfsPriErrorReason specifies the main reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum. The ccmTrapObjectNfsSecErrorReason specifies the secondary reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum or if there is no detailed reason then the value will be 9999 (no error).

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus %parm[#2]%;

event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortWriteErrorTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectNfsPriErrorReason=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectNfsSecErrorReason=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when an overrun occurs when writing to the file. If multiple consecutive overruns occur, this trap is only sent once, upon the occurrence of the first overrun. Once sent, this trap will not be sent again until a write operation has been successfully performed, and a period of 15 minutes has elapsed without any additional overruns or write operation failures. This trap is not sent if the most recent write operation failed or if a write operation failed within the preceding 15 minute period. (I.e. This trap is sent only when the status of the port is 'No recent errors.) The port number of the serial port on which the failure occurred is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber. The status of the serial port on which the error occurred is contained in ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus. (This is the status of the port at the time that the Trap was generated.) The ccmTrapObjectNfsPriErrorReason specifies the main reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum. The ccmTrapObjectNfsSecErrorReason specifies the secondary reason of failure and can have any value defined in NfsErrorReasonEnum or if there is no detailed reason then the value will be 9999 (no error).

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectNfsPortErrStatus %parm[#2]%;

nfsMountNeeded(1) nfsErrOpeningHistoryFileRetry(2) nfsErrOpeningHistoryFileFinal(3) nfsErrWriteCurrent(4) nfsErrWriteRecent(5) nfsOverrunCurrent(6) nfsOverrunRecent(7) nfsNoRecentErrors(9999)

event.descr:
This trap is sent if the status of a port changes to a status of 'No recent errors' from one of the current or recent write and/or overrun error status conditions. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber contains the number of the port that has no errors.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortNoRecentErrorsTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
The file open through a NFS port was successfully closed. The ccmTrapObjectPortNumber returns the serial port number where the file was open.

ccmTrapObjectPortNumber %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmNfsPortFileClosedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectPortNumber=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
A session to a SoL port has started. The name of the user who is connected to the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the SoL port that the session is using is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port connects to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The entity number of the SoL port that the session is using is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSolPortSessionStartedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A session to a SoL port has stopped. The name of the user who was connected to the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the SoL port that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port connects to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The entity number of the SoL port that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSolPortSessionStoppedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A session to a SoL port has been terminated or preempted by another user. The name of the user who terminated or preempted the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectUserName. The name of the user who was terminated or preempted from the session is contained in ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName. The name of the SoL port that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port connects to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The entity number of the SoL port that the session was using is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectUserName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#4]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSolPortSessionTerminatedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectUserName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectTargetUserName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#4]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
Loss of communication between a SoL port and its BMC. The name of the SoL port that has lost communication to its BMC is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port has lost communication with is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The reason for the loss of communication is contained in ccmTrapObjectLcmReason. The entity number of the SoL port that has lost communication to its BMC is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectLcmReason %parm[#3]%;

commFailure(1) loginFailure(2)

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSolPortLcmTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectLcmReason=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A SoL port has regained communication with its BMC. The name of the SoL port that has regained communication to its BMC is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port has regained communication with is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The entity number of the SoL port that has regained communication to its BMC is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSolPortRcmTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectIPAddress=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The name of a serial port has changed. The previous name of the serial port is contained in ccmTrapObjectOldName. The new name of the serial port is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The serial port number for which the name changed is contained in ccmTrapObjectPortNumber.

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;

event.descr:
The name of a SoL port has changed. The previous name of the SoL port is contained in ccmTrapObjectOldName. The new name of the SoL port is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port connects to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The entity number of the SoL port for which the name changed is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

event.descr:
The name of a power device socket has changed. The previous name of the power device socket is contained in ccmTrapObjectOldName. The new name of the power device socket is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The location of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSPCDeviceLocation. The port number on the appliance that the power device is attached to is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort. The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber. The socket number of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcSocket.

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#2]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation %parm[#3]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort %parm[#4]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber %parm[#5]%;

ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber %parm[#6]%;

ccmTrapObjectSpcSocket %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: avctCcmSpcSocketNameChangedTrap trap received ccmTrapObjectOldName=%parm[#1]% ccmTrapObjectServerName=%parm[#2]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceLocation=%parm[#3]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceCCMPort=%parm[#4]% ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber=%parm[#5]% ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber=%parm[#6]% ccmTrapObjectSpcSocket=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
The target device type changed for a serial port. The previous target device type for the serial port is contained in ccmTrapObjectOldTdType. The new target device type for the serial port is contained in ccmTrapObjectTdType. The entity number whose target device type changed is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

event.descr:
A SoL port has been added. The name of the SoL port that has been added is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port connects to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The TCP port used to connect to the new SoL port is contained in ccmTrapObjectTelnetPortNumber. The entity number of the SoL port that has been added is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#2]%;

event.descr:
A SoL port has been deleted. The name of the SoL port that was deleted is contained in ccmTrapObjectServerName. The IP address of the BMC the SoL port was connected to is contained in ccmTrapObjectIPAddress. The TCP port that was assigned to the SoL port that was deleted is contained in ccmTrapObjectTelnetPortNumber. The entity number of the SoL port that was deleted is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber.

ccmTrapObjectServerName %parm[#1]%;

ccmTrapObjectIPAddress %parm[#2]%;

event.descr:

The number of the power device that is connected to a port of the appliance is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceNumber. The entity number of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectEntityNumber. The inlet of the power device is contained in ccmTrapObjectSpcDeviceInlet.
